New Records: Florian Wirtz became Germany's youngest scorer in European Championship history.
Germany set the biggest opening-game margin of victory in the tournament's history.
Key Match Events: Germany scored three goals in the first half.
Scotland defender Ryan Porteous was sent off after a studs-up challenge.
Antonio Rüdiger scored an own goal in the 87th minute.
Emre Can scored a late goal in stoppage time.
Pre-Game Insights: Germany's captain Ílkay Gündogan emphasized the team's intensity and strategy.
Scotland's captain Andy Robertson criticized the team's first-half performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Julian Nagelsmann praised Germany's first-half performance.
Steve Clarke, Scotland's coach, acknowledged the team's struggles and the need for improvement.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Germany dominated possession from the start.
The match saw high-scoring with five goals in total.
